name: Gmail: display full address with name
description:
In message detail (not only), changes names
"To: joe, Joe, Joe"
to
"To: joe <joe@example.org>, Joe <someone.calling.himself.joe.in.his.profile@gmail.com>, Joe <another.joe.dude@gmail.com>".
additional_info:
Super simple style.

I really hate how Gmail formats recipient names by default. I would prefer FULL names (with surnames) displayed, not just meaningless first names. It seems there is not any preference or lab feature for this yet (is there?).

This style takes advantage of nice semantic markup of contact entries, which have @email with full adress in value - that's what this style reveals.
